security_audit.summary: This is a file cleanup utility skill with minimal risk. It uses bash scripts for standard file operations (read, write, move) on project documentation files. No network access, no credential exposure, and no persistence mechanisms detected. The skill operates within its documented scope of cleaning Plans.md, session-log.md, and CLAUDE.md files.

content.user_title: Clean up and organize project documentation
content.value_statement: Project documentation files like Plans.md and session-log.md grow large over time, making them difficult to manage. This skill automatically archives completed tasks, splits oversized logs by month, and keeps your project documentation organized and readable.
actual_capabilities: Archives completed tasks older than 7 days from Plans.md to an archive section
Splits session-log.md into monthly files when it exceeds 500 lines
Warns when CLAUDE.md exceeds 100 lines and suggests splitting into docs/
Creates automatic backups before cleaning files
Detects cleanup needs based on file size and task completion dates
Supports dry-run mode to preview cleanup actions before execution
limitations: Only manages Plans.md, session-log.md, and CLAUDE.md files
Does not clean binary files, logs, or build artifacts
Cannot restore accidentally archived tasks without manual intervention
WIP tasks marked with cc:WIP or pm:‰æùÈ†º‰∏≠ are protected from archiving

use_cases.title: Keep project plans tidy
use_cases.description: Automatically move completed tasks to an archive section after 7 days, keeping Plans.md focused on active work.

use_cases.title: Manage session history
use_cases.description: Split growing session logs into monthly archived files, keeping current sessions fast and searchable.

use_cases.title: Optimize CLAUDE.md size
use_cases.description: Receive warnings when CLAUDE.md becomes too large and get guidance on splitting into topic-specific files.

prompt_templates.title: Selective cleanup

prompt_templates.title: Automated check
prompt_templates.scenario: At session start to check file health
prompt_templates.prompt: Check my project files. Are there any that need cleanup based on the size thresholds?

Recommendation: Archive 8 tasks to keep Plans.md manageable

best_practices: Run cleanup regularly, such as at the end of each sprint or weekly
Review archived tasks monthly to ensure nothing important was accidentally moved
Configure thresholds in .claude-code-harness.config.yaml to match your project needs
anti_patterns: Using cleanup on files that are actively being edited by multiple team members simultaneously
Archiving tasks that still need reference without keeping a backup copy
Ignoring CLAUDE.md size warnings, which can slow down Claude Code context loading

faq.question: What files does this skill manage?
faq.answer: It manages Plans.md, session-log.md, and CLAUDE.md files. Other file types are not affected.

faq.question: Will it delete my tasks?
faq.answer: No. Completed tasks are moved to an archive section within Plans.md or split into monthly files. Original data is preserved.

faq.question: Can I customize the size thresholds?
faq.answer: Yes. Edit .claude-code-harness.config.yaml to set custom values for max_lines and archive_after_days.

faq.question: Is my data safe during cleanup?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill creates automatic backups before making changes. You can also use dry-run mode to preview first.

faq.question: What happens to work in progress tasks?
faq.answer: WIP tasks marked with cc:WIP or pm:‰æùÈ†º‰∏≠ are protected and will not be archived, even if completed.

faq.question: How is this different from other cleanup tools?
faq.answer: This skill uses LLM evaluation to make smart recommendations based on task age and completion status, not just file size.
